incident_updates.body:
We are pleased to announce the successful completion of our IPv6 migration!

Throughout this migration process, we have worked diligently to ensure a seamless transition, minimizing any potential impact on your workloads. Our team has closely monitored the migration to ensure stability and performance across all services.

We understand that adapting to new technologies can present challenges. If you are encountering any database-related issues post-migration, these may be due to the broader changes across various service providers as they also transition to IPv6. We are here to support you through these adjustments.

As part of our commitment to staying in step with industry trends, we're implementing IPv6 support across our network. This upgrade aligns with similar shifts by leading cloud and database providers. We anticipate a seamless transition without any impact on customer workloads. However, if you encounter any database-related issues, it may be linked to the broader changes across your various service providers. Should you specifically experience issues with Accelerate, we urge you to contact us for assistance.

Description: The incident with the upstream provider has been resolved. We are continuing to monitor and anticipate no additional impact.

Affected users: All

Root cause: Upstream provider is experiencing a major incident

Workarounds: None

Description: There are intermittent 500s being caused by an upstream provider. These 500s are within our SLA although we're monitoring the situation closely.

Affected users: All

Root cause: Upstream provider is experiencing a major incident

Workarounds: None

incidents.name: Accelerate disruption to new query engine starts

incident_updates.body: Our team has identified the root cause of the issue and applied a fix. No further issues have been identified.

Description: Our team detected an increase in Accelerate 500 responses resulting from failures to allocate new query engines. We were able to associate the issue to a particular deployment and rollback. We're continuing to monitor for any further disruption.

Affected users: users requiring new query engines due to Prisma version updates, Prisma schema changes, or returning from idle activity

Root cause: code deployment affecting request to internal service

Workarounds: None identified

Description: A brief disruption to internal services that did not have customer impact.  

Affected users: None

incidents.name: Accelerate ap-northeast-2 region intermittent network issues in internal services

incident_updates.body:
Description: The Accelerate ap-northeast-2 region experienced a brief period where requests to replace instances in the region's pool encountered network connectivity issues. This resulted in the workflow succeeding though not acknowledging the event on the queue, causing unnecessary retries and creating an automated incident. No user-facing impact occurred, as the region pool had an excess of instances ready to serve requests.

Affected users: None.

Root cause: Intermittent connectivity between internal services.

Workarounds: Not required.

Description: We are investigating the impact of a suspected disruption that was automatically detected by our system.

Affected users: Currently unknown

Root cause: Currently unknown

Workarounds: None identified

Description: Accelerate raised an automatic incident for a potential warm pool issue due to failed queue messages. This was caused by a brief network disruption causing the requests to the warm pool manager to disconnect, while the operation to replace the instance succeeded. We've confirmed that all regions have a healthy number of warm instances and no impact service impact was identified.

Affected users: none

Root cause: queue messages not acknowledged

Workarounds: not required

Our mitigation was successful and we've observed a full recovery of Accelerate services.
Cloudflare is experiencing an increase in errors in their DNS service, status page below. We have identified a mitigation and are monitoring it.
As we continue to investigate, we recommend that you do not deploy any changes that could affect your database queries or schema.

incidents.name: Increased Cold Start Times on Accelerate

incident_updates.body:
Description: We are investigating the impact of an internal Queue that backed up. The system is functional. Affected customers will observe increased cold start times of an additional 1 minute. Existing workloads are not affected by this.

Affected users: All customers starting a new Query Engine.

Root cause: One of the internal Accelerate Queues on Cloudflare stopped processing messages.

Workarounds: Do not deploy changes to your Application in order to not trigger a cold start.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Description: Our monitoring detected a reduction in healthy instances in our ap-south-1 pool. One instance failed to be replaced due to a brief network disruption. We have manually recovered the ap-south-1 pool to its desired state. No users were impacted by this incident.

Affected users: None

Root cause: Brief network disruption in ap-south-1

Workarounds: Not required

Description: We are investigating the impact of an existing outage that was automatically detected by our system.

Affected users: Currently unknown

Root cause: Currently unknown

Workarounds: None identified

incidents.name: Partial Accelerate service disruption in eu-central-1

incident_updates.body: This issue has been resolved. All Accelerate regions are reporting healthy statuses.
We've deployed a resolution and are monitoring the results.
We've identified an issue starting new Query Engines in eu-central-1. A temporary mitigation has been applied and a proper solution is in progress.

Description: We are investigating the impact of an existing outage that was automatically detected by our system.

Affected users: Currently unknown

Root cause: Currently unknown

Workarounds: None identified

incidents.name: Cloudflare API Outage Causing Downtime In Some Circumstances

incident_updates.body: All services have been fully restored. More information about the Cloudflare outage itself can be found here: https://blog.cloudflare.com/post-mortem-on-cloudflare-control-plane-and-analytics-outage/

Accelerate remains mostly functional for customers from what we are able to observe. We are continuing to monitor the situation with Cloudflare.

We continue to recommend against uploading new schemas or deploying changes to your queries.

The majority of Accelerate functionality has returned to service. We are continuing to monitor, however our observability is limited due the ongoing Cloudflare outage. For that reason, we still recommend that you refrain from updating your Prisma schema.

The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Some Cloudflare services are still being recovered and creating new Accelerate projects or generating new API keys are still impacted.

Description: The Cloudflare API is experiencing an outage causing failures in query engine orchestration.

Affected users: Customers attempting to start a new query engine would be unable to do so.

Root cause: https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/

Workarounds: Investigating

**Recommendation**: Please refrain from updating your Prisma schema. Updates to the Prisma Schema require a start of a new Query Engine which is not working right now. Keep your schema as is and your workloads won't be affected.
This incident has been resolved.

Description: increase in latency for all customers in the affected region. A fix has been implemented and we are continuing to monitor the eu-central-1 clusters.

Affected users: all users in the affected region

Root cause: currently unknown. It seems that nodes are being incorrectly flagged as unhealthy and replaced. We have implemented a change to mitigate this issue while we continue to investigate.

Workarounds: none identified
We are currently investigating increased Data Proxy errors in the eu-central-1 region.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Latencies continue to look nominal after mitigation.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

The incident has been mitigated and we have identified the steps needed to prevent this incident from continuing to occur.
After refreshing problematic nodes we are seeing latency return to typical levels. We will continue to monitor and investigate the root cause.

incidents.name: Partial outage of Data Proxy in eu-central-1

incident_updates.body: During a routine upgrade of Data Proxy we encountered an issue where the configured AMI did not contain any Prisma Query Engine images. The incident has been resolved and we are investigating the root cause.
The incident has been resolved. Both us-east-1 and eu-central-1 are fully operational.
The fix has been rolled out on all clusters of both us-east-1 and eu-central-1. We are continuing to monitor the results.
We have started rolling out the fix for the issue.
An issue related to the certificates used by Data Proxy has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating Data Proxy errors in some clusters of the us-east-1 and eu-central-1 regions.

incidents.name: Investigating reports of Data Proxy errors in us-east-1

incident_updates.body:
The situation has been resolved. We'll provide an update with a root cause and corrective measures as we understand this issue more.

If you need additional support, or are observing issues, please open a ticket after logging in at cloud.prisma.io

Restarting the nodes has mitigated the issue and the us-east-1 cluster is healthy. We are continuing to monitor the health of the cluster.

If you need additional support, or are observing issues, please open a ticket after logging in at cloud.prisma.io
We identified unhealthy nodes in our us-east-1 cluster and have initiated restarts for the affected instances.
We are currently investigating reports of Data Proxy errors in the us-east-1 region.

incidents.name: Partial outage on Data Proxy in us-east-1

incident_updates.body:
We have investigated reports of request timeouts when using the Data Proxy in the us-east-1 region. We have applied a mitigation and are continuing to monitor the results.

If you need additional support, or are observing issues, please open a ticket after logging in at cloud.prisma.io
This incident has been resolved.

We are currently seeing an elevated number of errors when accessing the Web interface of the Prisma Data Platform. An upstream issue with one of our providers has been identified, and we are waiting on a fix to be rolled out. For more information, please visit https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status

incidents.name: Control Plane API unavailable for 65 minutes

incident_updates.body: A faulty deployment with the Control Plane API caused the Client UI to exhibit errors. The Data Proxy was not affected during this time period. Services have been restored and the deployment failure is currently under investigation to improve the process.

We have a mitigation plan in place for the intermittent increased latency and degraded performance we have observed on the Data Proxy in the last week.
We will be monitoring the situation and address any issues that surface through further investigations.

If you need additional support, or are observing issues, please open a ticket after logging in at cloud.prisma.io

We’re investigating reports of instances of intermittent increased latency for certain projects on specific clusters when using the Data Proxy.
If you need additional support please open a ticket after logging in at cloud.prisma.io

incidents.name: Issues with accessing the Control Plane

incident_updates.body: The incident has been resolved.
We are investigating an issue that prevents users from interacting with the Control Plane.
As a result of an issue making a request to the GraphQL API of the Control Plane, parts of accessing project specific pages on the Control Plane were intermittently unavailable.

incidents.name: Incorrect downtime was reported due to monitoring misconfiguration

incident_updates.body: The GraphQL API was shown as having a major outage between 2am UTC and 7:28am UTC. However, this was due to incorrect reporting of the monitoring stack. The actual uptime was unaffected. We apologize for the misleading reporting.
Requests originating from Prisma 4.4.0 were temporarily failing. Other Prisma versions were uneffected.
This incident has been resolved.
The fix has been implemented and we're rolling it out to multiple clusters.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We're currently mitigating the incident that causes connecting to Data Proxy fail with "Cannot fetch data from service: certificate has expired".

incidents.name: Falsely reported downtime due to status check errors

incident_updates.body: Our automated status checks falsely reported a major and a partial Data Proxy outage for a couple of minutes. All systems were operational which is confirmed by our logs and secondary checks. We identified the problem with our status checks and fixed it.

incidents.name: Falsely reported downtime due to automation errors

incident_updates.body: Our automated status checks falsely reported a major Data Proxy outage for approximately 4 hours. All systems were operational which is confirmed by our logs and secondary checks. We identified the problem with our automation and fixed it.

incidents.name: Prisma data platform Web UI unavailable for 40m

incident_updates.body: A faulty deployment caused the Web UI to show a client error. The Data Proxy was not affected. We reverted the change to restore service and will conduct a review to improve the process.

incidents.name: Falsely reported downtime due to automation errors

incident_updates.body: Our automated status check falsely reported a major Data Proxy outage for approximately 2 hours. All systems were operational which is confirmed by our logs and secondary checks. We identified the problem with our automation and fixed it.

Due to a faulty deployment some of the users experienced authentication errors when using the Data Proxy.

The faulty deployment was reverted. A fixed version was already rolled out.
